summary:
A heart attack happens when blood flow to the heart is blocked, causing damage to the heart muscle. The main symptom is chest pain that spreads to the shoulder, arm, or jaw. Other signs include trouble breathing, nausea, and feeling tired. Women might experience different symptoms, like neck or arm pain.

High blood pressure, smoking, and diabetes are risk factors. Treatment is crucial and includes taking aspirin, opening blocked arteries, and using medications to dissolve clots. Lifestyle changes and long-term medications are essential after a heart attack.

Heart attacks are common, affecting millions worldwide each year, but rates have decreased over time.
title: Myocardial infarction
